    • Constructor Detail

      • Component

        public Component(int left,
                 int top)
        The default constructor for a component. For your component to be laid out correctly, make sure you use the x and y parameters from Application#init(int x, int y) and pass them into the x and y arguments of this constructor.

        Laying out the components is a simple relative positioning. So for left (x position), specific how many pixels from the left of the application window you want it to be positioned at. The top is the same, but obviously from the top (y position).

        Parameters:
        x - the application x position (from Application#init(int x, int y).
        y - the application y position (from Application#init(int x, int y).
        left - how many pixels from the left
        top - how many pixels from the top

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Layout layout)
        Called when this component is initialized. You can add sub-components through this method. Use Layout.addComponent(Component)
        Parameters:
        layout -

      • handleTick

        public void handleTick()
        Called when the game ticks

      • render

        public abstract void render(com.mrcrayfish.device.core.Laptop laptop,
                            net.minecraft.client.Minecraft mc,
                            int mouseX,
                            int mouseY,
                            boolean windowActive,
                            float partialTicks)
        The main render loop. This is where you draw your component.
        Parameters:
        laptop - a Laptop instance
        mc - a Minecraft instance
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        windowActive - if the window is active (at front)
        partialTicks - percentage passed in-between two ticks

      • renderOverlay

        public void renderOverlay(com.mrcrayfish.device.core.Laptop laptop,
                          net.minecraft.client.Minecraft mc,
                          int mouseX,
                          int mouseY,
                          boolean windowActive)
        The overlay render loop. Renders over the top of the main render loop.
        Parameters:
        laptop - a Laptop instance
        mc - a Minecraft instance
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        windowActive - if the window is active (at front)

      • handleClick

        public void handleClick(int mouseX,
                        int mouseY,
                        int mouseButton)
        Called when you mouse button has been pressed. You have to do your own checking to test if it was within the component's bounds.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        mouseButton - the clicked mouse button

      • handleKeyTyped

        public void handleKeyTyped(char character,
                           int code)
        Called when a key is typed from your keyboard.
        Parameters:
        character - the typed character
        code - the typed character code

      • handleKeyReleased

        public void handleKeyReleased(char character,
                              int code)
        Called when a key is released from your keyboard.
        Parameters:
        character - the released character
        code - the released character code

      • handleDrag

        public void handleDrag(int mouseX,
                       int mouseY,
                       int mouseButton)
        Called when you drag the mouse with a button pressed down.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        mouseButton - the pressed mouse button

      • handleRelease

        public void handleRelease(int mouseX,
                          int mouseY,
                          int mouseButton)
        Called when you release the currently pressed mouse button. You have to do your own checking to test if it was within the component's bounds.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the x position of the release
        mouseY - the y position of the release
        mouseButton - the button that was released

      • updateComponents

        public final void updateComponents(int x,
                                   int y)
        This method should be ignored. Used for the core. Will probably be removed in the future.

      • setEnabled

        public final void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether this component is enabled. You should respect this value if you create your own custom components.
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • setVisible

        public final void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether this component is visible. You should respect this value if you create your own custom components.
        Parameters:
        enabled -
